intro: Mitragyna parvifolia, commonly known as the lesser kratom, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves contain alkaloids, which have been traditionally used for their stimulant and analgesic properties. Due to its medicinal potential, it is of interest in both botanical and pharmacological research.
